story:
PROJECT TITLE: From YYC to YYZ

 

HOW FAR YOUR SUPPORT WILL TAKE US:

Donate $25 and up “Alberta...just startin’ out” - A pat on the back for supporting local Calgarian artists

Donate $50 and up  “Saskatchewan...singin’ some tunes” - An original thank you card designed by Ashley Ohman, signed by all the artists and a CD by The ArvbSpring.

$100 and up “Manitoba.... bathroom breaks” - A copy of the DVD “Alternative Currency” highlighting the artists within the travelling exhibition, the exhibition catalog and a CD by The ArvbSpring.

$250 and up “Ontario... We made it Yea!!!” - A signed print from one of the artists, the exhibition catalog, a CD & private show by The ArvbSpring, a copy of the DVD “Alternative Currency” highlighting the artists within the travelling exhibition, and a catered front row seat at the panel talk.

ABOUT THE PROJECT:

Six emerging artists and one documentary filmmaker have an exhibition in Toronto and need help getting there! This trip is important in its attempt to contribute to a much needed dialogue and exchange of ideas between artists from their respective cities across Canada. We propose to bring art produced in Calgary to another major centre in Canada: Toronto. As emerging artists we feel the need to contextualize our work nationally and build our community beyond our own borders.

The YYC to YYZ Exhibition will present a collection of work from each of the artists that represents their own practice while at the same time capturing the same ambitious DIY spirit discussed in Alternative Currency.  By sharing their work, views, and interests the artists hope to connect with a new audience and artists from a different city so as to initiate new relationships, share best practices and cultivate a national dialogue between the cities.  Through this exhibition there also lies the potential to begin exchange exhibitions between artists and galleries from across the country.

This exhibition is inspired by Lewis Liski’s inaugural documentary, Alternative Currency. Alternative Currency which premiered in front of a 200-person audience and opened the 2013 MISC Festival, is a feature length documentary that focuses on five emerging artists in the fourth year of their Bachelor of Fine Arts Degrees and the landscape that these artists enter into in the year Calgary was awarded the distinction of cultural capital of Canada. By giving the history of Calgary's art scene, from its grass roots initiatives to its do-it-yourself attitude, Alternative Currency attempts to answer whether there is an alternative to Calgary's current art landscape, if there is hope for these emerging artists, and how a city known for its western stampede could become a contemporary arts centre.

 

THE SHOW:

 

YYC to YYZ will be exhibited at Norman Felix Gallery and in partnership with Friendly Wealth, located at 627 Queen Street West in downtown Toronto from August 7th-14th. The entire trip will take place from July 27 to August 18, 2013

 

FROM YYC to YYZ:

As aspiring artists, sometimes our dreams are bigger than our wallets. But that doesn’t mean we won’t try to make things happen. Driving to Toronto from Calgary is no small task, but we will try nonetheless. We will be travelling in a red minivan with a trailer in tow full of art. Six educated people in one vehicle traveling across Canada in search of knowledge and experience, shoved together like a family on vacation, will inevitably have it’s interesting occurrences. Lewis Liski will be there documenting the trip and exhibition to create a short documentary that will be screened shortly after our arrival back. A catalog will also be produced in conjunction with the show and will feature writing and content from all of the artists. There will be a panel discussion at the Alberta College of Art and Design with the artists involved following the trip.

We have the show already booked and the work is currently being produced. The artists featured will include:

Natasha Alphonse, Ashley Ohman, Lindsay Falk, Kris Weinmann, Jesse Stilwell, Roman Abdoullaev  & Dan Zimmerman (The ArvbSpring).

The work produced for the show will range from sculpture, photography and media installation, to drawing, painting and performance. What more could you possibly ask for?!!

WHERE YOUR SUPPORT WILL GO?

We are attempting to raise $2660. The money will be broken down into three sections with the priority of funds starting from the top down.

1. Travelling in the Minivan (Gas, Flat Tires) – $1360

- ($120 & 600km/tank, 6800km round trip = $1360)

2. Accommodations (Motel 6, Travelodge) - $800.00

-(2 Rooms @ avg. $100/rm/nght x 4 nights)

3. Promotion (Posters, Flyers, Media, Catalog) - $500.00

Accommodation- we will all be staying with family, friends, or friends of friends.

Food & Day to Day costs - Our hope is that the potential sale of some of our artwork will help us offset the day-to-day costs of food and travel while we are in Toronto as well as any shortfalls in our fundraising.


HOW WILL IT BENEFIT CALGARY?

Our intention is to share our art, experiences and ambitions beyond our own borders in a way that inspires and stimulates the healthy growth of our communities.

Upon returning, there will be a presentation and panel discussion at the Alberta College of Art and Design (Date to be announced) where we will be premiering the short documentary and launching the catalogue. The panel discussion will examine the cohesion of arts communities in Canada and how artists from Calgary contribute to an inclusive and progressive dialogue with artists and other major art centre’s across Canada.

MORE INFORMATION ON ALTERNATIVE CURRENCY AND THE ARTISTS:

alternativecurrencyfilm.com

krisweinmann.com

lindsayfalk.com

zimmermandan.com

thearvbspring.tumblr.com

agohman.tumblr.com
story_txt:
PROJECT TITLE: From YYC to YYZ
 
HOW FAR YOUR SUPPORT WILL TAKE US:
Donate $25 and up “Alberta...just startin’ out” - A pat on the back for supporting local Calgarian artists
Donate $50 and up  “Saskatchewan...singin’ some tunes” - An original thank you card designed by Ashley Ohman, signed by all the artists and a CD by The ArvbSpring.
$100 and up “Manitoba.... bathroom breaks” - A copy of the DVD “Alternative Currency” highlighting the artists within the travelling exhibition, the exhibition catalog and a CD by The ArvbSpring.
$250 and up “Ontario... We made it Yea!!!” - A signed print from one of the artists, the exhibition catalog, a CD & private show by The ArvbSpring, a copy of the DVD “Alternative Currency” highlighting the artists within the travelling exhibition, and a catered front row seat at the panel talk.
ABOUT THE PROJECT:
Six emerging artists and one documentary filmmaker have an exhibition in Toronto and need help getting there! This trip is important in its attempt to contribute to a much needed dialogue and exchange of ideas between artists from their respective cities across Canada. We propose to bring art produced in Calgary to another major centre in Canada: Toronto. As emerging artists we feel the need to contextualize our work nationally and build our community beyond our own borders.
The YYC to YYZ Exhibition will present a collection of work from each of the artists that represents their own practice while at the same time capturing the same ambitious DIY spirit discussed in Alternative Currency.  By sharing their work, views, and interests the artists hope to connect with a new audience and artists from a different city so as to initiate new relationships, share best practices and cultivate a national dialogue between the cities.  Through this exhibition there also lies the potential to begin exchange exhibitions between artists and galleries from across the country.

story:
Hello, my name is David Shannon.  I'm an artist/student/grind slave living in Ocean Springs, Mississippi.  Ocean Springs is notably more art centric than most cities in south Mississippi, though in the 17 years i've lived here, there hasn't been an outstanding, outspoken artist community.  This project is an attempt to bring that community together.  

Art is as diverse as the people who create it, however, it seems as though our city has been playing it safe.  Themes are seldom explored and local artists are more widely accepted when they portray classic coastal art.  Needless to say, southern Mississippi is a place ripe with natural beauty.  Scenic art is definitely a style that every painter should explore, but to be limited to that is selling an entire cities worth of potential short. 

What i hope to accomplish is the construction of a mural wall where a full spectrum of artists will have full use of the space for one month to fully emmerse themselves in a chosen theme.  Specifically, 12 artists over 12 months regarding 12 themes loosely representative of a birth and death cycle and themes related to the human experience.  This project is designed to bring the art community and the general public together and keep the artistic process out in the open.  Relations have been established with a local newspaper where they will do a monthly spread regarding their piece and a 'meet the artists' article.  A local up-and-coming photographer will be hired to immortalize the artistic process so that the artist may keep a record for their portfolio, which will also add to the photographers reportoire.  this campaign, i and many others believe, will be a gateway that will open many doors for artists who seek to endeavor public projects, contemporary or otherwise.

All funding will see that the wall will be built in an aesthetically pleasing manner and congruous with the space it occupies.  Also, it will see to the compensation of the first few artist in the line-up based on time spent.  i do hope to get some outside sponsorship that would allow me to keep the space maintained and to finance future artists.  I'm in the process of developing a program that will allow the artist, at their discretion, to opt out of their compensation to help aid in local school art programs.

all contributors will be given a personal credit, read aloud, upon opening day, should we make it.  all procedes will go toward maintaining this project so we can shoot for even higher.  i will gladly accept any help, including just helping to get the word around.  i am in your debt.  thank you so much.

for a better community,

david.

 

9/22 Update!

i received an excellent quote from an experienced contractor, so glad that's out of the way.  i also found a young photographer who convinced me that he's devoted to the project.  official flyers will be printed soon.  also, a personal thank you to the local business owners who jumped so quickly to help out and to all those outside of my periphery who helped to spread the word.  tusen takk!

for a better community,

david.

 

9/26 Update!

both the flyers and the cad drawing for the wall are being finalized by the design team and the contractor, respectively.  also, the one and only shed bbq has entertained the idea of a fundraising event slotted for next month.  this project is pivotal and i'm very surprised that the community has so quickly taken an interest, though i must stress that this undertaking won't lift off the ground without a bit of financial aid.  thank you again for your support.

for a better community,

david

story:
Our mission is to fill a void in the Rochester art community by providing performance, exhibition and studio space that is accessible to emerging and non-commercial artists. We foster an environment of mutual support and productivity with and for our studio artists. Our programing, including bi-annual residency opportunities, provide unique developmental experiences for Rochester artists. In order for us to continue extending this support, we need support from you.

Studio and event space rentals keep our rent paid and keep the light on month to month, but there are so many little improvements we could make to better serve the artists we are here to support. Track lighting, fresh drywall, spackle, paint and so many more consumables go into creating an inspiring environment and a blank slate for each new artist to reinvent. The magic people experience when they come to The Yards is the result of endless hard work behind the scenes by dedicated volunteers who believe in our mission. If you have had a magical night at The Yards, show us your support so we can keep creating beautiful experiences for Rochesterians for years to come! We think you'll find a perk you'll enjoy. 

 

Local Artist & Residency Alumni- Nate Hodge

Working Community, Studio, & Gallery Space

Public Critiques, Workshops, & Guest Speakers

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hi! My brother and I have a web-based short documentary series idea that we call "Creative Textures". This web program documents local artists, their crafts, and their inspirational insight regarding creativity and the arts. This is a non-discriminatory program; people from any walk of life are eligible to be showcased, and as long as they consider what they do to be an artform, we would love to capture them and their ideas in a 2-5 minute video segment. We are heavily rooted in the art community of LA's south bay and love to see our friends get the recognition they truly deserve, which is the sole reason we want this program to happen. Creative Textures is set apart from any other documentary program of its kind because we do not just showcase someone's art; we take it a step further. We aim to figuratively "dissect" the subject and give them a chance to express in words the cathartic relationship they have with their art because, after all, art is just as personal as it is public. If all goes as planned, this program will delicately weave our "by the people, for the people" mentality with a high-quality elegance that people want to watch and that the artists will be proud of. 


We were fortunate enough to be granted one free half-day session at Studio 637, a local audio/video studio in Hermosa Beach, CA, with which we were able to come up with our "pilot" segment featuring Josh Beliso, a local sculptor. However, it is our goal to create an 8-10 segment pilot season of Creative Textures, and for that to happen we need to cover the costs of production, including video equipment rentals, lighting, and studio space. That is why we need your Support!!! by contributing, you are helping to get local artists the exposure that the deserve. Our team is deeply rooted in the art community of Los Angeles, and we love to see our friends shine through!

story:
Hello!

My name is Sierra Owens-Hughes, and I am a recent graduate of Union University. I majored in
ceramics and absolutely love working with clay, which is why I decided to be a studio potter. The
day has come for me to start working towards that dream job, but I can't do it on my own. I need your
help! I am asking you all to consider supporting that dream by helping me to buy a potter's wheel, as
well as a few studio basics like throwing bats and a set of shelves.

By helping me get a wheel, you're giving me the freedom to continue doing what I love most, making
pots. I have been dependent on my university for all my studio needs thus far, but now it’s time for me
to start building my own business outside of that space, and I would love for you to come alongside
me in this step.

My goal is $1,500, and here is how it breaks down:
Wheel  $1,200
Bats  $50
Shelves  $150

The remaining $100 would cover the remaining cost of shipping for the pots I send you in return!
If I exceed this goal, all the funds will still be going towards my studio. Some of the other expenses I would be able to pay for are studio rent, clay, tools, and glazes.
If you would like to support me in reaching this goal, there are a few ways that you can help.
1. Purchase one (or more) of the available perks and receive handmade pottery.
2. Spread the word! It's okay if you can't help me financially, but you can share this all over your social
media. Moral support goes hand in hand with financial support!

My most sincere thanks,
Sierra

story:
We're the Chalk Twins. Our goals are to have fun, inspire others, and learn and grow

Hi, we're Devon and Lexi and we're known as the Chalk Twins. We are 14-time, award-winning identical twin chalk artists. We have been chalking in front of festival crowds for nine years and anime/comic convention crowds for over a year.

We love anime! We want to bring art to the masses at these anime conventions. So many convention attendees are budding artists themselves. The most fulfilling thing we hear at conventions is when young artists say they are inspired to try their hand at chalk (or any other medium) because they watched us.

We've been lucky enough to have been invited to some of the largest conventions in the US - Anime Expo, Dragon*Con and MegaCon. Now we want to quadruple the number of conventions we attend in 2014 and go international.

Where we are Going, What we Need and What you Get

Here are the conventions we plan to attend. Some have already said yes. For this initial campaign we are only raising the funds for the ones that have said yes:

  • Taiyoucon, Mesa, AZ Jan 3-5 (yes), need $1,539
  • Ichibancon, Concord, NC Jan 9-12 (maybe), need $802
  • Swampcon, Gainesville, FL Jan 18-19 (yes), need $237
  • Ohayocon, Columbus, OH Jan 24-26 (maybe), need $1,060
  • Kawa Kon, St. Louis, MO Feb 7-9 (yes), need $738
  • Katsucon, National Harbor, MD (maybe) Feb 14-16, need $822
  • Con Nooga, Chattanooga, TN Feb 21-23 (yes), need $1,032
  • ROFCON, Virginia Beach, VA Feb 28-Mar 2 (yes), need $1,122
  • Tora Con, Rochester, NY Mar 8-9, need $272
  • Anime Matsuri, Houston, TX Mar 14-16 (yes), need $2,090
  • MegaCon, Orlando, FL Mar 21-23 (yes), need $50
  • Perth Oz Comic Con, Perth, AU Mar 28-30 (maybe), need $4,419
  • Kawaii-kon, Honolulu, HI Apr 4-6 (yes), need $3,171
  • Sabaku Con, Albuquerque, NM Apr 11-13, need $1,525
  • Anime Conji, San Diego, CA Apr 18-20 (yes), need $1,308
  • Calgary Expo, Calgary, AB Apr 25-28, need $1,582

$10,000 covers airfare, non-Con hotel days and car rental for the 9 conventions that have said yes. This doesn't include money for hotels during Con days, marketing, materials or food. We're hoping to get some other sponsorship to cover these additional costs. We will keep you updated if other shows invite us to attend. Any additional funds collected will go toward other shows. To attend all 16 of these shows will cost us approximately $22,000. That will be our stretch goal if we start to exceed the $10,000 we are looking to raise now. If this campaign is successful we'll be back to continue the second and third parts of this campaign to cover the entire year.

We think we've put together some great, unique perks to reward you for your contribution to our campaign. 

Bookmarks. We have five 2.5" x 7" bookmarks available - Fred and George Weasley, The Hobbit, Princess Mononoke, Tamaki and Sebastian. Each of these images are taken from original pieces we've created over the past year. It gives you an idea of what we are capable of doing if you've never seen our art before.

   

One of our Unframed Prints. We have a number prints available for you to choose from - Toph, Death the Kid, Dr. Stein, Sword Art Online, Edward Elric, Legion, Star Trek and Serenity. Each print will be signed by the Chalk Twins.

Chalk Twins T-shirt. We screen print these shirts ourselves. T-shirts will be available in Small, Medium, Large and Extra Large.

Framed Print. This image of Edward Elric from Fullmetal Alchemist is one of our most popular prints. We'll put this in a nice black frame so it's ready to be hung on the wall. Each print will be signed by the Chalk Twins.

Page from Devon's Sketchbook. In preparation for our 2014 tour Devon will be creating original sketches for each of the 16 shows we are looking to attend. Each  sketchbook drawing will be signed by the Chalk Twins.

Custom 2' x 2' Chalk Drawing. Here is a sample of a 2' x 2' character we did from Avatar: The Last Airbender. We'll do whatever you like in this same size - a portrait, your dog, your car, you name it. The finished piece will be on Masonite and coated with 4-5 layers of an archival spray fixative. The spray fix will protect the piece from touches, but like any artwork you should not rub the surface or get it wet. Framing will be the responsibility of the contributor. You'll just need to supply us with a reference picture.


Custom 2' x 3' Chalk Drawing. Here is a sample of a 2' x 3' landscape we did as a commission.  Just like the 2' x 2' perk we'll do whatever you like in this 2' x 3' size - a portrait, your cat, the car you have, the car you wish you had, you name it. The finished piece will be on Masonite and coated with 4-5 layers of an archival spray fixative. The spray fix will protect the piece from touches, but like any artwork you should not rub the surface or get it wet. Framing will be the responsibility of the contributor. You'll just need to supply us with a reference picture.

Hand-made, Leather-bound Book, 2'x3' artwork and t-shirt.  We'll personally create a hand-made, leather-bound book that includes pictures, sketches and notes of our tour experience. As a Chalk Twins VIP we will include your name in the book on our sponsorship page.

For the artwork we'll do whatever you like in a 2' x 3' size - a portrait or anything else you would like. The finished piece will be on Pastelbord. This is a professional work surface especially made for soft pastels that is 9 times more expensive than our regular materials. The piece will be coated with 4-5 layers of an archival spray fixative. The spray fix will protect the piece from touches, but like any artwork you should not rub the surface or get it wet. Framing will be the responsibility of the contributor. You will just need to supply us with a reference picture.

Risks

If we don't reach our goal then we'll still use the money we get to go to as many Cons as we can.

The Impact

Without your help we won't be able to attend all of the shows we are hoping to attend. Thousands of people will attend these shows. Hundreds have a dream to be an artist. We hope to influence even just one child to help them realize that they can draw and become an artist too.

We've done this for over a dozen Conventions so far and the results have been terrific. One little girl watched us work for about an hour at Dragon*Con. She said she was getting dragged all over the Con by her brothers but being able to watch us was the second best thing she had seen at Dragon*Con. (The number one thing was to meet one of her idols from a Disney show.) At one convention an attendee was emotionally moved by one of our prints. The fact that our work can touch someone that deeply makes us proud to be artists and validates everything we do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. It's a big world and you know people we don't know. Maybe they can help us too.

Thank you so much for your support.
story_txt:
We're the Chalk Twins. Our goals are to have fun, inspire others, and learn and grow
Hi, we're Devon and Lexi and we're known as the Chalk Twins. We are 14-time, award-winning identical twin chalk artists. We have been chalking in front of festival crowds for nine years and anime/comic convention crowds for over a year.
We love anime! We want to bring art to the masses at these anime conventions. So many convention attendees are budding artists themselves. The most fulfilling thing we hear at conventions is when young artists say they are inspired to try their hand at chalk (or any other medium) because they watched us.
We've been lucky enough to have been invited to some of the largest conventions in the US - Anime Expo, Dragon*Con and MegaCon. Now we want to quadruple the number of conventions we attend in 2014 and go international.


Where we are Going, What we Need and What you Get
Here are the conventions we plan to attend. Some have already said yes. For this initial campaign we are only raising the funds for the ones that have said yes:

Taiyoucon, Mesa, AZ Jan 3-5 (yes), need $1,539
Ichibancon, Concord, NC Jan 9-12 (maybe), need $802
Swampcon, Gainesville, FL Jan 18-19 (yes), need $237
Ohayocon, Columbus, OH Jan 24-26 (maybe), need $1,060
Kawa Kon, St. Louis, MO Feb 7-9 (yes), need $738
Katsucon, National Harbor, MD (maybe) Feb 14-16, need $822
Con Nooga, Chattanooga, TN Feb 21-23 (yes), need $1,032
ROFCON, Virginia Beach, VA Feb 28-Mar 2 (yes), need $1,122
Tora Con, Rochester, NY Mar 8-9, need $272

Anime Matsuri, Houston, TX Mar 14-16 (yes), need $2,090

MegaCon, Orlando, FL Mar 21-23 (yes), need $50
Perth Oz Comic Con, Perth, AU Mar 28-30 (maybe), need $4,419
Kawaii-kon, Honolulu, HI Apr 4-6 (yes), need $3,171
Sabaku Con, Albuquerque, NM Apr 11-13, need $1,525
Anime Conji, San Diego, CA Apr 18-20 (yes), need $1,308

Calgary Expo, Calgary, AB Apr 25-28, need $1,582

$10,000 covers airfare, non-Con hotel days and car rental for the 9 conventions that have said yes. This doesn't include money for hotels during Con days, marketing, materials or food. We're hoping to get some other sponsorship to cover these additional costs. We will keep you updated if other shows invite us to attend. Any additional funds collected will go toward other shows. To attend all 16 of these shows will cost us approximately $22,000. That will be our stretch goal if we start to exceed the $10,000 we are looking to raise now. If this campaign is successful we'll be back to continue the second and third parts of this campaign to cover the entire year.
We think we've put together some great, unique perks to reward you for your contribution to our campaign. 
Bookmarks. We have five 2.5" x 7" bookmarks available - Fred and George Weasley, The Hobbit, Princess Mononoke, Tamaki and Sebastian. Each of these images are taken from original pieces we've created over the past year. It gives you an idea of what we are capable of doing if you've never seen our art before.



     
One of our Unframed Prints. We have a number prints available for you to choose from - Toph, Death the Kid, Dr. Stein, Sword Art Online, Edward Elric, Legion, Star Trek and Serenity. Each print will be signed by the Chalk Twins.



Chalk Twins T-shirt. We screen print these shirts ourselves. T-shirts will be available in Small, Medium, Large and Extra Large.



Framed Print. This image of Edward Elric from Fullmetal Alchemist is one of our most popular prints. We'll put this in a nice black frame so it's ready to be hung on the wall. Each print will be signed by the Chalk Twins.

Page from Devon's Sketchbook. In preparation for our 2014 tour Devon will be creating original sketches for each of the 16 shows we are looking to attend. Each  sketchbook drawing will be signed by the Chalk Twins.
Custom 2' x 2' Chalk Drawing. Here is a sample of a 2' x 2' character we did from Avatar: The Last Airbender. We'll do whatever you like in this same size - a portrait, your dog, your car, you name it. The finished piece will be on Masonite and coated with 4-5 layers of an archival spray fixative. The spray fix will protect the piece from touches, but like any artwork you should not rub the surface or get it wet. Framing will be the responsibility of the contributor. You'll just need to supply us with a reference picture.
Custom 2' x 3' Chalk Drawing. Here is a sample of a 2' x 3' landscape we did as a commission.  Just like the 2' x 2' perk we'll do whatever you like in this 2' x 3' size - a portrait, your cat, the car you have, the car you wish you had, you name it. The finished piece will be on Masonite and coated with 4-5 layers of an archival spray fixative. The spray fix will protect the piece from touches, but like any artwork you should not rub the surface or get it wet. Framing will be the responsibility of the contributor. You'll just need to supply us with a reference picture.




Hand-made, Leather-bound Book, 2'x3' artwork and t-shirt.  We'll personally create a hand-made, leather-bound book that includes pictures, sketches and notes of our tour experience. As a Chalk Twins VIP we will include your name in the book on our sponsorship page.
For the artwork we'll do whatever you like in a 2' x 3' size - a portrait or anything else you would like. The finished piece will be on Pastelbord. This is a professional work surface especially made for soft pastels that is 9 times more expensive than our regular materials. The piece will be coated with 4-5 layers of an archival spray fixative. The spray fix will protect the piece from touches, but like any artwork you should not rub the surface or get it wet. Framing will be the responsibility of the contributor. You will just need to supply us with a reference picture.

The Impact
Without your help we won't be able to attend all of the shows we are hoping to attend. Thousands of people will attend these shows. Hundreds have a dream to be an artist. We hope to influence even just one child to help them realize that they can draw and become an artist too.
We've done this for over a dozen Conventions so far and the results have been terrific. One little girl watched us work for about an hour at Dragon*Con. She said she was getting dragged all over the Con by her brothers but being able to watch us was the second best thing she had seen at Dragon*Con. (The number one thing was to meet one of her idols from a Disney show.) At one convention an attendee was emotionally moved by one of our prints. The fact that our work can touch someone that deeply makes us proud to be artists and validates everything we do.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for your support.

story:
What is Playuzzle?

 

It's part art, part puzzle, and all cool. It's 16 lighted towers and 5 lighted buttons with 48 infrared beams. As you walk between the towers or press the buttons, you change Playuzzle. As you line up matching colors on adjacent towers, the EL-wire outline lights up on those towers. When you light all 16 towers, you've solved the puzzle, unlocking a wave of color, sound, and flashing light as your reward.

When it's too busy for puzzle solving, Playuzzle switches automatically to Art Mode, where the buttons become electronic paint buckets and you are a walking paintbrush.

This part is important. Like many large projects, we've had our delays and we owe it to you to be up front about it: we have scaled back our funding request to match what we can accomplish with reasonable certainty with the time remaining before the event - a smaller 4-tower version that will let people have fun while letting us verify the actual design in desert conditions. Your support gets us to the Playa this year, and next year we will do a 16- or 32-tower version. It's critical to get to Playa this year to make next year work.

By the way, Playuzzle makes for great self-portraits!

An early prototype made of wood and vellum
Our current design using steel pipe and tensioned fabric

What's Inside?

It looks so simple on the outside. What's inside?

Quite a bit, actually. It takes a lot of technology to bring Playuzzle to life. Each tower has a both multicolor LED lighting to light the tower and EL-wire to outline it. Up to 8 infrared transmitters and receivers detect your motion. Hidden speakers provide ambient music and sound cues. Strobe lights light up the sky when the puzzle is solved. Each tower has a custom-designed microprocessor-driven control board. Underground, a 350-foot trench network connects all of the towers, buttons, lampposts, power station, and control station providing power and data. Three separate pieces of software operate across 22 processors to create the environment, including a real-time music generator that designs music that reflects the state of the puzzle.

Our custom control board - note the words "Playuzzle Prototype"

What Do We Need?

We've spent two years designing, re-designing, and improving Playuzzle. We've built and tested all of the various components. Now we need your help for the final push, to purchase the materials to build all 16 towers, and to transport Playuzzle to the Playa.

Where Does the Money Go?

All work on Playuzzle is donated. About 75% of the money goes to the purchase of materials. The remainder goes to fundraising rewards and to transportation of the puzzle.

Our total budget is about $6,000 and we need about $3,500 to complete the mission. If we get a little more, we'll add more comfortable seating and a giant shade tarp for daytime shade. However we're asking for a litle less, and we'll bring a reduced version if we only receive basic funding, and grow it next year. But we need to get there this year to prove out the technology in the harsh playa environment.

Our Bill of Materials for Playuzzle is long, but if you like spreadsheets, the full budget is here: http://www.playuzzle.com/budget.pdf or http://www.playuzzle.com/budget.xlsx

Rewards

The biggest reward is, and should be, pride. It doesn't happen without you. But to help you feel even more a part of it, we have an array of rewards from shirts to dinner with the artist to owning your own Playuzzle tower. But a pldege of $25 receives our really cool Playuzzle medallion. (It's also included with any pledge of $100 or more). It's custom minted metal with 6 colors, and only supporters and team members get one.

Yup, it's metal and those are cutouts. It's 2" wide.

Try It Right Now!

Part of our development effort over the last two years has been modelling. Here is a rough playable demo. Use the arrow keys to navigate. Notice tower colors changing as you walk between them and outlines turning on as color line up. You can even "press" the button by walking into them (sort of, it's tricky!).

Click here to try it yourself ===> http://www.playuzzle.com/demo

Or click on the video below to just watch without controlling it  ===>

 http://youtu.be/1596_yPq1DU

Into the Future

There's more than just the desert. Playuzzle doesn't end when the Man burns! Many great pieces of art start on the Playa. We want to make Playuzzle available to the word as urban art. We'll let you build you own using our plans and software.And we're designing tools to let you control Playuzzle yourself, creating your own puzzles.

Can I Help?

Yes! Whether or not you can afford to help financially, we welcome your participation this year or next. If Playuzzle happens, we guarantee that Playuzzle II will be even cooler!

story:
Echipa

”Copacul de la Bibliotecă” a adunat mai multă lume în jurul său, dar cei care de mai bine de două luni îi rescriu povestea  prin munca lor sunt:

Mihai Stamati – designer, coordonator de proiect
Pavel Obreja – sculptor
Ion Zbancă – designer
Andrei Zbancă – designer

 

Pe scurt. Ce ne-am propus?

  • La un an distanță, platanul din fața Bibliotecii Naționale, doborât de ninsorile din aprilie 2017,  va reveni acolo unde a crescut, transformat în mobilier urban (bănci). Este vorba de modelarea masivului lemnos și îmbinarea lui cu elemente din metal, astfel încât băncile să fie dotate cu măsuțe pentru laptop și suport pentru biciclete.

 

Despre ”Copacul de la bibliotecă”

Am lansat un proiect care să povestească prin prisma designului despre copacii prăbușiți în Chișinău la sfârșit de aprilie 2017 și în același timp să ofere spațiului public o alternativă de mobilier urban realizat din trunchiului unuia din acei arbori. Ne-am propus ca scuarul Bibliotecii Naționale „Vasile Alecsandri” și Teatrul Republican de Păpuși „Licurici” să rămână și mai departe mediul platanului căzut după acele ninsori. Un mediu în care el ar continua să existe transformat în bănci de diferite dimensiuni şi configurații, create așa cum o permite trunchiul său. Se abordează o prelucrare de manieră sculpturală a copacului, iar prin concepția de design a acestui mobilier îmbinăm lemnul masiv (în forma sa brută ca material cald cu o mare varietate de texturi) și metalul negru  – ca element de contrast, structural și rece.

 

Impact

În final ne-ar plăcea ca băncile, parcarea de biciclete și restul elementelor rezultate din acest proiect să servească trecătorilor de pe strada 31 august 1989 un bun prilej pentru popas, dar și să ofere scuarului bibliotecii  condiții care să predispună la comunicare, interacțiune și evenimente culturale în aer liber.

Vrem să instalăm băncile acolo unde a crescut copacul exact la un an distanță după ce a fost luat din scuarul bibliotecii. 

 

Am lansat această campanie pentru că vrem să fiți parte din povestea platanului...

Lucrările sunt în plină desfășurare și de la o zi la alta bucățile de lemn  dictează felul în care va arăta produsul final. E un proces interactiv care implică improvizare continuă, adaptare a ideilor la trunchiurile de care dispunem și viceversa, aceasta fiind de fapt o provocare frumoasă.

O parte din bugetul proiectului a fost acoperit de către parteneri, ceea ce ne-a permis între timp să începem lucrul și să avansăm.  Pe final însă, ne-am dorit  să implicăm și societatea civilă așa încât să o avem complice în această poveste. Dincolo de necesitatea de a completa restul bugetului necesar pentru finalizarea și instalarea mobilierului  în scuarul bibliotecii, vrem să promovăm prin această campanie ideea de responsabilitate colectivă și asociere a fiecăruia din noi cu mediul în care trăim. Campania „Copacul de la Bibliotecă” țintește spre donații mici, dar numeroase, așa că vă îndemnăm să o faceți modest și molipsitor. Și noi, din modestie, sau poate din curaj, fixăm o limită de sus - donația nu poate fi mai mare de 30 USD.

Parteneri ai proiectului:
Direcția Cultură a primăriei mun. Chișinău
Universitatea Tehnică a Moldovei
AnyWay Travel
Biblioteca Națională a Republicii Moldova

Dincolo de rezultatul mucii noastre mai avem ceva de oferit - câte o mică părticică din povestea platanului. În ziua inaugurării, vom aduce un coș plin cu așchii, surcele, bucăți de lemn rămase de pe urma lucrărilor, cu inscripția #CopaculDeLaBiblioteca, pe care să le puteți lua cu voi ca magnet de frigider.

 

Mai multe detalii despre proiectul „Copacul de la Bibliotecă” puteți vedea aici

Dincolo de rezultatul mucii noastre mai avem ceva de oferit - câte o mică părticică din povestea platanului. story: .

Hello, welcome to our indiegogo campaign! 

We are Mathias and Kim and we are two artists based out of Dawson City, Yukon! Mathias is a silkscreen instructor, makes light sculptures, and is a budding graphic novelist! Kim studied printmaking and now makes sculptures and installations out of fur, textiles, paper mache, and other things. And we are *very* excited to announce we have been accepted to a residency in Nepal with the Marpha Foundation!

This is a great collaborative opportunity for us as artists, but unfortunately the residency fees are just a little outside our budget. The fees are $1500 USD in total, which comes to $1986 CAD (essentially 2000). We are already on the Indian Subcontinent at the moment, so getting to Nepal and surrounding costs of the residency are affordable to us! It is just the residency fees that we can't afford, and we do not want financial constraints to stop us from taking on such an amazing opportunity, so we are asking for your help (if you are able!) to send us to Marpha! 

About the Marpha Foundation

The Marpha Foundation is an NGO in the town of Marpha, Nepal that was founded in 2014! They work with children and families in the lower mustang region of Nepal and they work to improve local education. Unfortunately, rural communities in Nepal are often overlooked as backward and underdeveloped, which ignored a lot of the knowledges these communities have. So Marpha seeks to work with the communities in a way that honours their wisdom and works with the communities.

Marpha created the residency program because while they have been teaching their students art for many years, their students rarely have a chance to interact with art made by others. The residency program thus aims to expand the presence of artists in Marpha and create a collection of art pieces and art books for the children to interact with and enjoy. We will be donating the hard copy of the comic book that we are creating to the foundation, as well as potentially teaching a short silkscreen workshop to the children! 

Why this is so important to us!!

Artist Residencies are not only important cultural cross-fertilization, but excellent opportunities for learning and for working uninterrupted on a project! We have never had the opportunity to work on a project collaboratively before, and this residency will give us the time and space to do just that! This is an excellent opportunity for our careers; we will be able to create a finished product during this residency (a short story comic book) and network with artists and other villagers in Nepal. This is also Mathias' first residency!

But why do we need your help?

Unfortunately, while we have enough money to get to Nepal (we are currently travelling and so have a modest budget for backpacking around the indian subcontinent), we did not know we would be applying for and then getting this residency when we were initially setting off on our trip. We only saved enough money to support ourselves on a shoestring backpacker budget, not for a residency. 

The residency has a fee of $300 USD per week which covers the cost of room and board and studio in Marpha. In total this comes to $1500 USD or roughly $2000 CAD (as of January 2017's exchange rate). This is outside of our modest travellers budget that we have! While we can afford to get to Marpha, and to cover a portion of the fees, we don't have the money to pay for all of the fees. Especially with the current exchange rate between CAN and USD! This is also quite a last minute endeavour (it is now early January 2017, and the residency starts March 1st) and so applying for a grant is risky and even if we did get one we may not get it in time for the residency to start.

We are hoping to crowdfund between half and 3/4 of the residency fee if possible! Any little bit helps; even if we don't get all of the money covered, whatever we get will be put toward the residency fees (the rest will probably go on Kim's Visa, to be hopefully paid off later when we get home). We want to avoid going into debt, especially since both of us want to go back to school in September and will need to take out more loans for that.

But what do you get out of it??

We have come up with some fun perks if you want to donate to our little cause! Kim is selling some handmade things from her etsy store! There are also postcards, commissions, SPICE PACKAGES, original art, and of course a PDF or a physical copy of the comic book we are making on this residency!!

"But I don't have any money!"

Thats totally okay! We get that. If you cannot contribute financially, consider just sharing this with your pals! Any sharing on facebook or instagram or whatever social media you use will help us a lot, and we really appreciate it! There are indiegogo tools to share, or you can copy and paste the link directly! Sharing is Caring! <3

 

We'd like to thank you so much for reading this far and watching our video! We are very excited about this opportunity and don't want to have to go into debt to partake in this!
story_txt: Hello, welcome to our indiegogo campaign! We are Mathias and Kim and we are two artists based out of Dawson City, Yukon! Mathias is a silkscreen instructor, makes light sculptures, and is a budding graphic novelist! Kim studied printmaking and now makes sculptures and installations out of fur, textiles, paper mache, and other things. And we are *very* excited to announce we have been accepted to a residency in Nepal with the Marpha Foundation!This is a great collaborative opportunity for us as artists, but unfortunately the residency fees are just a little outside our budget. The fees are $1500 USD in total, which comes to $1986 CAD (essentially 2000). We are already on the Indian Subcontinent at the moment, so getting to Nepal and surrounding costs of the residency are affordable to us! It is just the residency fees that we can't afford, and we do not want financial constraints to stop us from taking on such an amazing opportunity, so we are asking for your help (if you are able!) to send us to Marpha! About the Marpha FoundationThe Marpha Foundation is an NGO in the town of Marpha, Nepal that was founded in 2014! They work with children and families in the lower mustang region of Nepal and they work to improve local education. Unfortunately, rural communities in Nepal are often overlooked as backward and underdeveloped, which ignored a lot of the knowledges these communities have. So Marpha seeks to work with the communities in a way that honours their wisdom and works with the communities.Marpha created the residency program because while they have been teaching their students art for many years, their students rarely have a chance to interact with art made by others. The residency program thus aims to expand the presence of artists in Marpha and create a collection of art pieces and art books for the children to interact with and enjoy. We will be donating the hard copy of the comic book that we are creating to the foundation, as well as potentially teaching a short silkscreen workshop to the children! Why this is so important to us!!Artist Residencies are not only important cultural cross-fertilization, but excellent opportunities for learning and for working uninterrupted on a project! We have never had the opportunity to work on a project collaboratively before, and this residency will give us the time and space to do just that! Any sharing on facebook or instagram or whatever social media you use will help us a lot, and we really appreciate it! There are indiegogo tools to share, or you can copy and paste the link directly! story:
UPDATE

After the overwhelming demand for the book outside of the campaign, I have decided to look into options at offering the book in some capacity online. We will mention when and where the books are available for purchase on the Kukubee facebook page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Kukubee-Designs/...
Sorry for Facebook link, but it's the easiest way to get a wide message across. Please don't feel any obligation to like or follow, but if you check that page periodically, we will be making announcements there.

The book may be offered in PDF format or a softcover version of the book. The limited edition signed, premium, hardcover books will most likely remain exclusive to campaign contributors. Perks will no longer be available and contributions made outside of the campaign will not be eligible to be mentioned on the Thank You page.

Also, the price for books outside of the campaign may not be the same as you see here.

Thank you everyone for your support and sorry to everyone who missed out on the campaign.

The Art of Glitch • A Hardcover Book of Images from the Game and World of Glitch

The Art of Glitch will be a 10" wide x 8" tall landscape hardcover book featuring full-page images from the game in rich color.

See the highlights of Glitch as experienced by players of the game along with full production game art, detailed pencil drawings and conceptual character art.

Readers will discover the evolution process of many of the game's core features and characters through iterative sketches and artboards along with alternate and rejected concepts never before seen.

A section of the book will be devoted to showcasing the multitude of unique visual styles and the most beautiful locations representing the world of Glitch.

Also, all campaign contributors will be welcome to join in on conversations pertaining to the contents of the book.

 

FAQs

  • When will the book come out?

We are planning on having the book done early (Feb-Mar) in 2013.

  • What's in the book?

Images of the various regions in Ur, some of the most beautiful streets, profiles of all the Giants, as many characters and creatures and items we could cram in, never before seen concept art and design proposals, some of the best player created snapshots, and everything that YOU want to see.

  • Who selects the art in the book?
I will be curating the book. But I won't be doing it alone. I will be reaching out to everyone that worked on the game, and more importantly, YOU. All campaign contributors will be welcomed to join in on discussions pertaining to the contents of the book. After all, the book is for you guys. From the lowest to the highest contributor, all your voices will be heard in determining what the most important inclusions in the book will be.

  • What does my money go towards?

Nobody likes asking for money. But the fact of the matter is, I can't afford to buy a book for everybody. And even if I were to order a whole bunch and then sell them to you guys, I would have no guarantee that they would sell and I may end up with a huge pile of books in my bedroom.

The funds raised will go towards:

    • The very high costs of producing hardcover books
    • Additional perks
    • Whatever that's left will go towards helping to fund Tiny Speck's next venture, and maybe buy me some time to create this book for you guys.

 

  • I have no money! How can I help?

Spread the word! Let everyone know about your experiences you had on Glitch. Get in contact with old Glitch buddies and let them know about this campaign. Mention it on Twitter or Facebook or wherever people hang out on the internet nowadays.

 

  • Will the books be available anywhere else?


Nope. The book will be a LIMITED EDITION run. I will order all the books (plus just a few extra for friends, family, and safe keepings) if and once the goal is reached and will not have a second print.

 

  • I don't care about the art but I want to help!

Our very talented friend, Danny Simmons, who was the man behind the music of Glitch has a indiegogo campaign of his own to preserve all the wonderful and amazing music and sound from the game. Get it now!

 

  • How much will shipping cost?

Shipping will be estimated to cost:

Canada                     $10-12

USA                          $13

Everywhere Else      $20

Expedited shipping will be available to all contributors and you will be informed of all your shipping options via email at the book's completion.

  • Are the example book cover and book pages subject to change???

Yup.


What is Glitch?

Glitch was the wonderfully whimsical online game developed by Tiny Speck, Inc. In 2012, Glitch was nominated for two GDC Online Awards, for Game Design and Visual Art. The mission of this campaign is to preserve all the incredible art from the enormous, ever-changing, persistent world of Glitch.

Everywhere Else      $20

Yup.

What is Glitch?
Glitch was the wonderfully whimsical online game developed by Tiny Speck, Inc. In 2012, Glitch was nominated for two GDC Online Awards, for Game Design and Visual Art. The mission of this campaign is to preserve all the incredible art from the enormous, ever-changing, persistent world of Glitch.

story:
The horror of the Holocaust is as important today as it was 70 years ago.  We must not forget the lessons of the Holocaust and of the evil a single human being can wreak upon mankind.  Genocide is an evil that permeates the modern world, especially in emerging nations; a population that is plagued by economic unrest and dissatisfaction with the government is easily led.  It is frightening that even today there is a movement amongst certain right-wing extremist groups to deny that the Holocaust even took place.

On a more personal level, I have been subject to stereotypes, character assassination, exclusion, and malicious gossip.  Because of the persistent bullying, I became suicidal. I almost died.  I feel because of these experiences I have some validity in approaching this subject matter.  

The finished piece will go to a non-profit like the Jewish Community Center, a synagogue or Holocaust Museum. 

BUDGET

Listed alphabetically

Armadillo Clay Work

1 Kaoboard     $100

Holland Photo

  1  18x24 photographic print on Epson Display Trans material  $100

Holocaust Library 

  rights, photograph/film  $100

Imagine Art

  graphics and vector file  $100

James Lynn

  24 joints-cut, fit, solder and finish silver  $1500

Miscellaneous 

  fluctuations in the price of silver, perks, Indiegogo  $500

Regal Plastics

  1   fabrication of the anchors  $200

Rio Grande

120”  sterling silver, rectangular wire, .315”x.079”  $600

  1 oz.  silver solder  $100

SoCo Industrial Arts

2  CNC routing-Kaoboard  $200 

2  CNC routing-acrylic  $200

  CNC routing-barbed wire  $200

  Consulting  $300.

All perks are prints of original art I have done.  Please visit my website www.nicolecreek.com. for my resume and list of shows and sales.  Most notably a $2500 sale to the daughter-in-law of the former governor of Texas. 

If I dont reach my goal, I will do only the Star of David panel.

I have a degree in mathematics with a minor in fine arts and work as a systems analyst for 15 years including Lockheed/Martin on the space shuttle.  I am accustomed to work on detailed projects of extended duration.  I also did some repousse work in college which is a process of raising copper(or other metals) with fine tools into a design.  I am currently working in goldleaf.  I have a penchant for working with metals and have always had a facination with transparencies as they take the 2 dimensional into the 3 dimensional.

The technical part of the project will be done by SoCo Industrial Arts.  They specialize in lasers and CNC(Computer Numerical Control) routing.

Professor James Lynn will do all the silver crafting which requires precision and skill. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please share on facebook and with your friends.

story:
My Objective

For the past 9 years I have been stenciling koi around America. In June I will be traveling to 4 cities to paint my koi stencils. Chicago, Milwaukee, Madison, and Detroit are my main stops. These stencils are quite unique in that you can literally make 32 different patterned koi before you need to repeat it. This helps make groupings look more natural and visually interesting  If this is more successful then I imagined I will add more cities.

Why Koi?

People have asked me for years what is the meaning or purpose of the koi I stencil on sidewalks across America. Well the answer may be simple but it has a lot of meanings both to me as a person and to the symbols of harmony, strength, good fortune, friendship, success, prosperity, longevity, courage, ambition, and perseverance.

  In 2006, while finishing my last art degree in Photography, at Pecks School of the Arts in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, I had the opportunity to travel around china for three months to study ancient and contemporary art. While I was looking at communist posters I also was looking at Chinese scrolls and learning the different hidden messages and iconography that are under the surface of the koi image. The koi symbolize several lessons and even trials individuals often encounter in life. The koi has a powerful and energetic life force, its ability to swim against currents and even travel upstream. Other symbolism of the koi includes, good fortune, success, prosperity, longevity, courage, ambition, and perseverance. The number of koi also symbolizes a different and unique message that correlates with the Chinese lucky numbers. During the time of the cultural revolution the ancient ways of thinking and symbols where to be literally destroyed to make way for a new modern China.

  One symbolizes strength, courage, overcoming obstacles, friendship, good fortune, success, and longevity. Two is a symbol of double happiness or good things come in pairs. It is often used in wedding decorations for a happy life in marriage.  The word three sounds like the word birth and represent the three stages of life. Said to be birth, marriage and death.  Four is an unlucky number. In Chinese the word four sounds very much like the word death and for that reason four is never used in china for several things including placement of four objects.  Five has two meanings; first it symbolizes transformation as it took the emperor five arches to walk through to actually get to the Forbidden City. There are four walls surrounding Beijing. Each wall has more levels of security, where the very last arch would be the Forbidden City doors making the five arches.  The second meaning has to do with the five elements of the universe. Earth, Wind, Water, Fire and Metal. China realized early on that a metal fell from the sky in the form of a meteoroid. While we have the four elements of earth in western society china has chosen to include the universe as a fifth element, metal. Six is a symbol for business relationships, and sounds like the word flow in terms of wealth. While seven is for more personal relationships like with friends, family and neighbors. Eight sounds like the word prosper or wealth and symbolizes good fortune, which is often used in new business to help generate wealth. Nine historically has to do with the emperor; it is believed that the dragon has nine children. It also symbolizes harmony.

What You Get

  • A total of 8 custom made and hand cut stenciled stickers from 4 of my original designs. Each sticker is a original work of art in multiples, hand stenciled and die cut on USPS stickers to keep it legit street art.

  • Hand stenciled t-shirt with 2 unique koi. Each stenciled image of the koi is unique making no two shirts exactly alike. 2 is a symbol of double happiness and also good things come in pairs.

  • A signed copy of San Francisco Street Art by Steve Rotmen. The book contains 4 pictures of art making me the most credited artist in the book. A must-have for any street art enthusiast, this book presents the most mind blowing examples of renegade creativity in San Francisco.

  • A hand stenciled koi print on artist paper with one koi on each. Each is signed and dated and ready to be framed. No two prints are exactly alike.

  • A one of a kind hand stenciled koi on wood. Measuring 12x18 inches this one of a kind koi stencil hangs beautifully in your house or office. Each koi stencil is unique and no two paintings are alike.

  • A unique one of a kind stenciled window. Each window is roughly 32x26 inches and will have 3 koi which is the symbol for "The three stages of life." Birth, Marriage and Death. No two koi or windows are exactly alike.

  • A unique one of a kind koi painting on a glass window. Each window measures roughly 34x32 inches and contains 5 koi which is the symbol for Transformation. No two koi or windows are exactly alike.

  • Along my travels to paint koi I will paint you a custom one of a kind mural of koi or birds. You can find examples of my past murals at www.JeremyNovyStencils.com Some locations may not be available and size to be determined.

The Impact

The impact of my koi has gone far beyond a 16 inch spray painted stencil. It has crossed social, racial, political and many more boundaries we face in our public day to day travels. You can pretty much guarantee if you spot one you will smile, but not only that. You can have a conversation with someone of a totally different background about the koi and most likely be a very pleasant ice breaker to social conversations. 

People have since had them tattooed on them, painted cars, murals, and even getting best public art of 2013 in Milwaukee, WI by reader vote in through the local newspaper. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you donate or not please make sure to share this indegogo on your own social media sites. Thank You for your support in painting america koi.

A hand stenciled koi print on artist paper with one koi on each. Each is signed and dated and ready to be framed. No two prints are exactly alike.




A one of a kind hand stenciled koi on wood. Measuring 12x18 inches this one of a kind koi stencil hangs beautifully in your house or office. Each koi stencil is unique and no two paintings are alike.


A unique one of a kind stenciled window. Each window is roughly 32x26 inches and will have 3 koi which is the symbol for "The three stages of life." Birth, Marriage and Death. No two koi or windows are exactly alike.


A unique one of a kind koi painting on a glass window. Each window measures roughly 34x32 inches and contains 5 koi which is the symbol for Transformation. No two koi or windows are exactly alike.


Along my travels to paint koi I will paint you a custom one of a kind mural of koi or birds. You can find examples of my past murals at www.JeremyNovyStencils.com Some locations may not be available and size to be determined.
    The Impact The impact of my koi has gone far beyond a 16 inch spray painted stencil. It has crossed social, racial, political and many more boundaries we face in our public day to day travels. You can pretty much guarantee if you spot one you will smile, but not only that. You can have a conversation with someone of a totally different background about the koi and most likely be a very pleasant ice breaker to social conversations. 
People have since had them tattooed on them, painted cars, murals, and even getting best public art of 2013 in Milwaukee, WI by reader vote in through the local newspaper. 

    Other Ways You Can Help If you donate or not please make sure to share this indegogo on your own social media sites. Thank You for your support in painting america koi.

story:
Short Summary

Dear Supporters!

We are Ardesia Projects, a bi-lingual initiative dedicated to stimulating an international debate around photography and the visual arts. We are a platform for artists run by artists, with the aim of supporting each other in our development whilst contributing to the wider photographic conversation. 

We are now curating our first exhibition, for which we have invited three fabulous artists: 2016 Magnum Photos/Photo London Graduate Award-winning Seán Padraic Birnie, James William Murray, whose work Beheld recently selected for the Athens Photo Festival Photobook Exhibition, and Alberto Sinigaglia, with his critically acclaimed project Big Sky Hunting.

The exhibition will take place during  Brighton Photo Fringe 2016 at Naked Eye Gallery from the 3 - 18 October* and will explore the role of visibility and invisibility in photography, placing different bodies of work together in order to make new and unexpected connections.

Additionally, during the private view at 6 pm on the 3rd of October we will be launching Ardesia Projects UK, inviting British artists to submit their work for review and widening our network. 

*Please note date was moved forward to the 3rd of October after the video was made!

www.ardesiaprojects.com

www.seanbirnie.com

www.albertosinigaglia.net

www.jameswilliammurray.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

To make this happen we need to raise £2000 which will cover the following costs; 

- Exhibition space rental

- Shipping of the Artworks from Italy 

- Plane ticket for Alberto Sinigaglia

- Printing the catalogue about Ardesia Projects and SCREENED 

- Advertisement on the Brighton Photo Fringe hand-out 

- Posters and Flyers 

- The private view

Lots to cover! In exchange for your support, you will receive precious artworks by the artists, including limited edition prints, signed books and much more. Below you can see the rewards on offer. Don't miss out on this great opportunity to acquire original works! 

LAST WEEK SPECIAL DEALS (available until Thursday 15th) 

For our last week of campaign we have decided to offer some special combo packs of works from our exhibiting artists and from our curator Benedetta Casagrande.

Do not miss this occasion to get art at great deals! 

Fine art prints from 'Round Midnight (A5/£5,A4/ £15,A3/ £25) 

 

'The Séance Room' and one black polaroid 

'The Séance Room', fiber based print from 'Paraphernalia' , one black polaroid

Copy of 'Beheld', a xerographic print of 'Head of a Youthful Divinity', two postcards from 'Reflections' series

Copy of 'Beheld', one 24k. Gold Leaf polaroid (Untitled, St. Raphael May '15), two postcards from 'Reflections' series 

 

Perks

 

Black polaroids by Seán Padraic Birnie (perk for £10)

 

Xerographic poster print from Head of a Youthful Divinity by James William  Murray (perk for £15)

 

 

'Reflections' proof prints by James William Murray (Perk for £25)

 

'Paraphernalia' fiber-based photographic darkroom print (Perk for £30)

 

Untitled  (St Raphael May 15') Exposed  Gold Leaf Polaroids by James William Murray (Perk for £35)

 

A3 print from 'Memories of the Overlook Hotel' by Séan Padraic Birnie (Perk for £35)

 

'Big Sky Hunting' limited edition poster on newsprint by Alberto Sinigaglia (Perk for £50)

30x24cm print from Alberto Sinigaglia's 'Big Sky Hunting (Perk for 100£ - print of your choice)

 

'The Séance Room' signed soft cover book by Séan Padraic Birnie (hard cover in image)

 

'Beheld' signed book by James William Murray

 

'Big Sky Hunting' signed book by Alberto Sinigaglia

 

254x169 cm framed digital c-type print on dibond from Memories of the Overlook Hotel by Seán Padraic Birnie (Perk for 500£) 

 

Special Perks #2 ( expiring Monday 5th Sept. 12 noon). 

Ardesia Projects' editor and creative director Michele Amaglio print pack from the series Traum Jesolo. 

Available in different sizes
A5 (21x15 cm / 8.3x5.8") at £5
A4 (29,7x21cm / 11.7x8.3") at £15
A3 (42x29,7cm /16.5x11.7") at £25


 

 

 

 

 

 

SPECIAL BANK HOLIDAY PERKS (28th-29th Aug.  / OFFER EXPIRED) 

Prints from 'Round Midnight by our curator Benedetta Casagrande

 

Untitled (Fish Cyanotype) from 'Round Midnight

Untitled (Phantom Embrace) from 'Round Midnight

There is no Witness of the Violence Between You and I (The Sweet Caress) diptych from 'Round Midnight

There is no Witness of the Violence Between You and I (The Sweet Caress) diptych from 'Round Midnight

 

The Impact

 

All funds raised will go towards the production of the exhibition and your contribution will help meet the costs outlined above. This exhibition will be the first of what we hope to be many Ardesia Projects group exhibitions that bring together artists from the UK and Italy. So please help us make this first exhibition a great success! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We know many of you would love to help but for whatever reason cannot offer financial support. But do not worry! There are other ways you can support us by helping us spread the word! Share it on your Facebook, tell your friends, send it to anyone you know who might be interested, perhaps send it to your grandma. Grandmas always help.

story:
The 2020 Lunar Mandala Calendar

I started drawing mandalas 10 years ago as a spiritual practice. I created my first Lunar Mandala Calendar in 2015 as a vehicle for sharing my artwork with the world.

This calendar is entirely hand-drawn and features new artwork each year.

It's an interactive calendar, the intention is for you to color the mandalas each month, write in your new moon intentions, and follow your year in lunar time.

Learn more about the calendar and how to use it here!

Funding Goals:

  • My base-level funding goal is to raise $1600. This will cover the majority of the initial printing costs.
  • A stretch-goal is to raise $2000. This will cover ALL of the printing costs as well as the cost of my website and ordering shipping materials.
  • Anything above and beyond $2000 will start paying me for my time, and will help put gas in the car and food on the table!
  • If you want to skip-over the crowd-funding platform and order your calendar directly from me, you can visit www.thelunarmandalacalendar.com/store.html

story:
The Story

Hi! We’re Rana and Saif, a recently married Egyptian couple. Our marriage has just turned one so we're excited to launch this project as a celebration!!  We’ve been planning for it for over two years now and the lockdown has given us a chance to materialise it. We’re very happy to finally share 'Fun Pharaoh' with the world.

We both run Letterlust which is a graphic design studio and gift shop. Saif comes from a business background and Rana is a Graphic designer. We're both stationery enthusiasts so this project is the perfect tribute to our passion and heritage. 

For thousands of years Pharaohs have used colours widely in their artefacts. This was the inspiration behind our designs. The concept is to create Egyptian souvenirs that are fun and modern. If you're in doubt of what to buy for your friends or simply into Egyptian art then this project is for you ;)

 

Fun Pharaoh Products

This campaign will help us produce:

1. A set of three colourful hard enamel pins.

2. A set of three black and gold luxury hard enamel pins. 

3. A set of four postcards (postcards are an add on perk that can be purchased at checkout). 

These are the ten designs going to be produced in the first phase, final products may vary slightly.

 

Colourful Hard Enamel Pins

 

Luxury Gold Hard Enamel Pins

 

Postcards (available during checkout)

 

Specs

All our hard enamel pins are made of pure zinc alloy material in order to ensure light weight and strength. The colourful 'Fun Pharaoh' pins are plated with black nickel while the 'Luxury' pins are plated in gold for a more premium look and feel. Pins come attached to a backing card with information about its history and a black rubber clutch that is sturdy and tight. Our postcards are A6 and are printed on semi glossy coated 350 gsm paper for long lasting anti-scratch cards, the back is always uncoated for ease of writing with any kind of pen or pencil. 

 

 

Plan & Timeline

Our current goal is to reach £1,000 in preorders. The campaign will run for 30 days. Right after the campaign ends every backer will be sent a survey to choose the final perk and have one final chance to change delivery address. Later we’ll start production and shipping will take place starting September 2020. We will be communicating with our backers to let them know of any possible delays due to current pandemic. Our suppliers have been very helpful and are always on time so fingers crossed!

 

Stretch Goals

After the campaign achieves its first target for every extra £500 we will unlock 2 more enamel pin designs. This initial fund will kick-start our endeavours to sell our products to stockists in cities with a lot of tourism revolving around Egyptian monuments like Cairo, Giza, Luxor, London, Turin, Paris & Berlin. Do you think we can do it? We think we CAN!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Support

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Give us a shout out on your social media by sharing the campaign!
  • Instagram, Facebook, Twitter or Tiktok word of mouth can go a long way.
  • Use the hashtags #enamelpins #postcards #funpharaoh #letterlust #thisisegypt
  • Here is a link to the campaign to make it easier for you: https://igg.me/at/funpharaoh

 

 

Find us online

Instagram: www.instagram.com/letterlust.shop

Icons made by Freepik and developed by Letterlust 

 

Lots of love from Egypt ❤️

story:
The Puzzlement Laboratory

Hi, my name is christian xtn hansen and i created The Puzzlement Laboratory 2 years ago as a vehicle for my work. The PL is a travelling experiment in community based participatory Arts & Crafts Projects. Drawing from 20+ years of social change activism, i created The PL as way to allow our differences to be an invitation to community.

Now in Cleveland in conjunction with The Gay Games 9 (August 8 - 16), The PL is setting up a bunch of activities to engage the many communities of Cleveland and the participants and spectators of The GG9.

This fund raising campaign is to cover expenses during this time in Cleveland and hopefully a bit beyond! And hopefully there will be enough to pay me a small wage!

Supplies like card board, paint, chalk, markers, cake and frosting making stuff, and then things like printing costs, fuel, signage and food. And if we are successful there will be some money to pay me a small amount of money for my time and effort! Working with locals to coordinate the use of things like folding tables and a pop-up canopy and volunteers.

The PL has received support from friends and now with their encouragement a larger social media campaign is happening to allow it to grow and flourish.

Why Cleveland? Why GG9?
A year and a half ago a friend saw how my work was evolving from Social Change Activism which incorporated arts and crafts into Arts & Crafts that incorporated tools of social change and she said "August! 2014! Cleveland! You have to be there! The Gay Games!"  Having been in Chicago 8 years ago during GG7 i saw the need for something else. So what i am offering is The Puzzlement Laboratory!

We have 4 main projects for during The GG9:

  • Personal Globalization- Globes to decorate with different ways!
  • Hands Up-Hands Down-Hands Out-Hands In: A Mail Art Puzzle!
  • In The Moment Comic Book Sessions!
  • Inter-Galactic TransGender Warrior Cake Decorating Experience!

Visit the Blog for more details!
http://thepuzzlementlaboratory.blogspot.com/search?updated-min=2014-01-01T00:00:00-08:00&updated-max=2015-01-01T00:00:00-08:00&max-results=1

Or find us on Facebook!

We have teamed up with The LGBT Center of Cleveland and they are hosting several events. Also coordinating with The North Union Farmers Market people to visit several of the Markets before and during the Games to set up activities.

And working on finding other locations to create these interactive temporary autonomous zones of mingling, creativity and community!  We'll be at some of the official GG9 spaces too!

The Puzzlement Laboratory is researching ways to show:
how every effort counts, is meaningful and significant,
that our differences are invitations to community,
how vulnerability is healthy,
how multiple perspectives are necessary.
OK IS OK!
And more!

Our experiments are meant to challenge and critically engage people in fun inclusive ways and give them experience with tools of expression and communication.

Every small and large contribution to the campaign is the appreciated. Every little bit matters!

Sharing the campaign and knowledge of The Puzzlement Laboratory is always awesome. Let people know about our work, invite us to your community. Or follow along vicariously and utilize the tools as you can in your life.

It's all good!

Please share with your friends! Follow along on Facebook and the blog!
Look for updates here!
with pleasure in the struggle
christian hansen
The Puzzlement Laboratory

story:
One Motorcycle Show

My name is Brenden Smith and I am an artist, mostly a painter.  I have promised 3 large painted pieces (48” x 60”) to the 1 Motorcycle Show in Portland, OR, Feb 13, 14, and 15th and am trying to raise gas and lodging funds to get my paintings and myself up there. 

An artist is always trying to get their artwork in front of as many of the right type of people as possible and this show, in it’s sixth year is an amazing opportunity.  To have every bike builder, bike blogger and industry representative in the US in attendance, as well as every curious motorcycle enthusiast in the Portland, OR area, see my art at this even may result in a sale or other opportunity. 

It’s hard to cash a check on a maybe, so I’m asking my friends for help.

It’s almost 4,000 miles, round trip from my apartment in Aspen, CO to the middle of Portland, OR.  My truck gets a 16mpg.  Gas is cheap right now but if I estimate it at $4 a gallon, we’re talking $1000.  I added $500 for food, lodging and missing three days of work.

This is a big deal and a huge gamble that I’m not used to making.  Some financial backing and support from my friends would go a long way to making this happen for me.  $20 is good, $50 is awesome.  If you throw down $100 or more I’ll get you a signed art print of one of my newer pieces. 

More info about the 1 Motorcycle Show:  http://the1moto.com

My Artwork Tumblr:  http://mrbrendenjsmith.tumblr.com
